oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pharmacokinetics and Pulmonarydynamics of 3-Methylindole Toxicity in Horses
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Thomas, David E.
Beadle, Ralph E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: 3-Methylindole
metabolites
acute pulmonary edema
emphysema
pneumotoxicant
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 3-Methylindole (3MI), a ruminal metabolite of Î³-tryptophan and its metabolites cause acute pulmonary edema and emphysema (APE) when administered to goats, sheep and bovine species. The pharmacokinetics and pulmonarydynamics of 3MI were investigated as a possible pneumotoxicant causing heaves in horses.
